intro: Heterisia eastwoodiae, commonly known as the Eastwood's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
